summary: This is an automated out-of-office email reply from an individual, likely a prosecutor or legal professional, referencing an article titled 'Epstein Ruling Puts Pressure On Acosta, DOJ' from Law360. The email indicates the recipient is unavailable and provides an emergency contact.

persons.name: Acosta
persons.context: Referenced in the subject line of the forwarded article 'Epstein Ruling Puts Pressure On Acosta, DOJ', indicating he is facing scrutiny related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Listed as the emergency contact for the out-of-office individual, suggesting they are an Assistant United States Attorney.

events.title: Publication of Epstein Ruling Article
events.description: An article titled 'Epstein Ruling Puts Pressure On Acosta, DOJ' is published or circulated by Law360, generating attention.

keyFacts: An out-of-office email reply references a Law360 article titled 'Epstein Ruling Puts Pressure On Acosta, DOJ' dated February 25, 2019.
The email suggests the sender is a legal professional (likely a prosecutor) given the emergency contact is listed as 'AUSA' (Assistant United States Attorney).
The subject indicates that a judicial ruling in the Epstein case was creating political or professional pressure on Alexander Acosta and the Department of Justice at that time.
